sections.heading: Detailed Ghost Coloring Tips
sections.text: A. Blending: Use a white pencil or crayon. Gently blend to create a soft, misty look. Layer darker grays on top for a smoky effect. B. Textured Effects: Use the side of a pencil or crayon. Create a grainy, static-like texture over the ghost. This looks like the ghost is transparent and flickering.

tips.colors: Use white, gray, and black for ghosts. Start with light gray as the base color. Use darker grays and blacks for shading and details. Add bright colors too! Make ghosts purple, blue, or any color you like.
tips.challenge: Color a haunted house scene with ghosts! Use complementary colors that sit opposite on the color wheel, like purple and yellow. This contrasting color scheme makes the ghosts eye-catching against backgrounds. It boosts creativity by coordinating vivid color combinations.
